The {COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}{0}{/COLOR} Party won a duel against the {COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}{1}{/COLOR} Party.
{COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}{0}{/COLOR} defeated {COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}{1}{/COLOR} in a duel.

I've prepared {COLOR r=249 g=173 b=129}a special gift{/COLOR} for this Easter.{CR} But monsters took all the gifts! What do I do?{CR}You will get {COLOR r=249 g=173 b=129}Egg Set{/COLOR} if you teach those monsters a lesson.{CR}And don't worry about giving it back to me. I prepared them for you anyway.{CR}{CR}{COLOR r=109 g=207 b=246}Location: Any where{/COLOR}

During all the memorable historical events such as Ingen Independence War or foundation of Rendel Kingdom, supporters of the dark, {COLOR r=141 g=198 b=63}Assassins{/COLOR} were always there. {CR}{CR}{COLOR r=244 g=154 b=193}※{/COLOR}{COLOR r=161 g=134 b=190}Burning Time Event {/COLOR}{COLOR r=249 g=173 b=129}for commemorating Assassin Update!{/COLOR}{CR}{COLOR r=109 g=207 b=246}Time: Jan 22 to Feb 26 from 12PM to 2 PM, 8PM to 10PM{CR}Buffs: Increased EXP gain, Increased character stats, Increases Life and Energy regen speed

Now, we're finally ready for the New Year's day!{CR}{COLOR r=244 g=154 b=193}Various event quests and items{/COLOR} are waiting for you.{CR}It'll be like a {COLOR r=161 g=134 b=190}New Year's gift package{/COLOR}! Haha!{CR}{CR}Ahh... If you have some spare time, {COLOR r=249 g=173 b=129}could you help us? We're having a hard time because of the New Year's gang.{/COLOR}{CR}I'm not really scared of them, but it'd be just nice if you could have helped.{CR}{CR}{COLOR r=109 g=207 b=246}Location: Ingen Port{/COLOR}

Santa Domings from the snowy lands of the north have come to Ingen.{CR}However, instead of delivering presents to the children, they are drinking their sorrows away at Timot's Inn.{CR}You must help liven up their spirits so that Ingen will have a happy Christmas!{CR}{CR}{COLOR r=109 g=207 b=246}Location: Ingen Port{/COLOR}

{COLOR r=249 g=173 b=129}'Trick or Treat!'{/COLOR}{CR}Give me Halloween candy! Give me festival pumpkins!!{CR}These will be available {COLOR r=244 g=154 b=193}only during the event period!{/COLOR}{CR}Are you ready to collect them and trade for cool items?{CR}{COLOR r=249 g=173 b=129}The Hell Road event is waiting for you, so don't hesitate to challenge the Ghost Rider!{/COLOR}{CR}{CR}{COLOR r=109 g=207 b=246}Location: Ingen{/COLOR}{CR}{COLOR r=124 g=197 b=118}You are invited to the HALLOWEEN PARTY!{/COLOR}
{COLOR r=255 g=245 b=104} Gift From Rosaline!{/COLOR}
{COLOR r=255 g=245 b=104} Assassins, ones with extreme body strength.{/COLOR}
{COLOR r=255 g=245 b=104} Today is- the New Year's Day!{/COLOR}
{COLOR r=255 g=245 b=104} Happy Holiday with Santa Domings{/COLOR}
{COLOR r=255 g=245 b=104} Happy Halloween Event {/COLOR}

The amount of damage received from physical and magical attacks diminishes depending on how many armor points you have. You will need superior armor in order to enhance your survivability. If the armor is too heavy, however, your magic skills and agility will suffer.
Slightly increases Elemental Defense.{CR}*Bonuses may vary depending on the equipped weapon.
Increases Max Health. Slightly increases Physical and Magic Attack.{CR}*Bonuses may vary depending on the equipped weapon.
Increases Physical and Magic Critical.{CR}*Bonuses may vary depending on the equipped weapon.
Used for magic skills and some physical skills.
You will die when your HP reaches 0.
Increases Magic Attack. Slightly increases Physical Attack and Elemental Defense.{CR}*Bonuses may vary depending on the equipped weapon.
Used for blocking, dodging, and most Physical Skills.
Increases Physical Attack. Slightly increases Magic Attack.{CR}*Bonuses may vary depending on the equipped weapon.

{CR} Press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[W][A][S][D]{/COLOR} to move your character. Use the mouse to move the camera.{CR}{CR}{BITMAP name=wasdKey w=185 h=125}{BITMAP name=wasdKey_r w=185 h=125}{CR}{CR}{CR} Press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[E]{/COLOR} to talk to NPCs. {CR}{CR}{BITMAP name=eKey w=185 h=125}{BITMAP name=eKey_r w=185 h=125}

{CR} {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0} [Left-click]{/COLOR} to attack monsters.{CR}{CR}{BITMAP name=LBtnClk w=185 h=125}{BITMAP name=LBtnClk_r w=185 h=125}{CR}{CR}{CR} Press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[E]{/COLOR} to collect loot items from defeated enemies.{CR}{CR}{BITMAP name=eKey w=185 h=125}{BITMAP name=glean_r w=185 h=125}

{CR} Press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[F]{/COLOR} to draw your weapon or to put it away.{CR}{CR}{BITMAP name=fKey w=185 h=125}{BITMAP name=fKey_r w=185 h=125}{CR}{CR}{CR} Press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[Ctrl]{/COLOR} to turn the mouse cursor on or off.{CR}{CR}{BITMAP name=Ctrl w=185 h=125}{BITMAP name=Ctrl_r w=185 h=125}

{CR} Press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[R]{/COLOR} to enable Auto Run.{CR}{CR}{BITMAP name=Run w=185 h=125}{BITMAP name=Run_r w=185 h=125}{CR}{CR}{CR} Click on a quest in the {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}Quest Tracker{/COLOR} to {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}display the destination on the mini-map{/COLOR}.{CR}{CR}{BITMAP name=QShow w=185 h=125}{BITMAP name=QShow_r w=185 h=125}

{CR} {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}Press Attack (left-click) immediately after pressing Forward ([W]){/COLOR} for an advancing attack.{CR}{CR}{BITMAP name=Assault w=185 h=125}{BITMAP name=Assault_r w=185 h=125}{CR}{CR}{CR} {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}Press Attack (left-click) immediately after pressing Back ([S]) {/COLOR}for a retreating attack.{CR}{CR}{BITMAP name=Evasion w=185 h=125}{BITMAP name=Evasion_r w=185 h=125}

{CR} {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[Right-click]{/COLOR} to block enemy attacks.{CR}{CR}{BITMAP name=GuardKey w=185 h=125}{BITMAP name=GuardKey_r w=185 h=125}{CR}{CR}{CR} Dodge enemy attacks by pressing {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[Shift]+[W], [A], [S], or [D]{/COLOR}.{CR}{CR}{BITMAP name=DodgeKey w=185 h=125}{BITMAP name=DodgeKey_r w=185 h=125}

{CR} Monster parts and weapons can be picked up by pressing {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[E]{/COLOR}.{CR}{CR}{BITMAP name=BP w=185 h=125}{BITMAP name=BP_r w=185 h=125}{CR}{CR} Assign a primary and secondary weapon in the {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}Character Window{/COLOR} and press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[Tab]{/COLOR} to switch between the two quickly.{CR}{CR}{BITMAP name=QuickChange w=370 h=125}

{CR} Restore Health by using recovery items or healing skills. Certain monster parts can restore Health as well. {CR} When not in battle, press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[Z]{/COLOR} to sit down. While sitting, you will recover Health, Energy, and Stamina more quickly.

{CR} Press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[Ctrl]{/COLOR} to activate the cursor. Place the cursor over the buff icon in the top right corner of the screen, near the mini-map, to see what effect the buff produces.

{CR} The durability of your equipment will fall as you use it, or when you are killed. {CR} The effectiveness of your weapons and armor decreases dramatically when their durability falls below a certain level. {CR} To restore equipment durability, talk to an NPC who can perform repairs and click the {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}Repair{/COLOR} button.

{CR} Press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[Enter]{/COLOR} to open the chat window and chat with nearby users. {CR} You can also communicate by entering commands in the dialogue window.{CR}{CR}Chat: {COLOR r=220 g=220 b=100}/s {/COLOR}{CR}Whisper:{COLOR r=220 g=220 b=100} /w, /whisper{/COLOR}{CR}Whisper reply:{COLOR r=220 g=220 b=100} /r, /reply{/COLOR}{CR}Party chat:{COLOR r=220 g=220 b=100} /p, /party{/COLOR}{CR}Guild chat:{COLOR r=220 g=220 b=100} /g, /guild{/COLOR}{CR}Field chat:{COLOR r=220 g=220 b=100} /f, /field{/COLOR}

{CR} For trades, duels, party formation and friend invitations, approach another player and press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[E]{/COLOR}.{CR} The following chat commands can also be used to invite players to join your party.{CR}{COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}/invite [character name]{/COLOR}{CR}{COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}/i [character name]{/COLOR}

{CR} Resurrection Items: {CR} If you are killed, you can use a resurrection item to return to life on the spot. These items have a cooldown of 30 minutes, so use them wisely! {CR} Soulstones: {CR} You can also choose to resurrect at the nearest Soulstone. Your Health, Energy, and Stamina will be restored by 25%. {CR}Instances: {CR} If you die in an instance, you can resurrect at the most recent checkpoint. Your Health, Energy, and Stamina will be restored by 25%. {CR}{CR}WARNING!{CR} - Dying will reduce the durability of all equipped items by 10%. {CR} - If you are Level 11 or higher and you resurrect at a Soulstone or a checkpoint, you will suffer Extreme Fatigue for a set amount of time.

{CR} Press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[H]{/COLOR} to open the Character Window. This window displays your {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}character status{/COLOR}, {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}stats{/COLOR}, and {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}equipped items{/COLOR}. {CR} The other two tabs display your status with various {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}factions{/COLOR} and any {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}skills{/COLOR} you have learned.
{CR} Press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[I]{/COLOR} to open your Inventory. Click on the tabs to categorize your items.
{CR} Press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[J]{/COLOR} to open your Journal. This window displays recipes, quests, and information about your character's adventures and development.
{CR} Press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[T]{/COLOR} to open the Skill Window. This is where you can spend Skill Points to learn new skills.
{CR} Press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[P]{/COLOR} to open the Social Window. This window displays your party, your guild, and your friends.

{CR} {BITMAP name=Tutorial1002 w=280 h=200}{CR}{CR}Press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[M]{/COLOR} to open the Map. Here you can view a map of the current field, as well as the {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}World Map{/COLOR} and the {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}Simple Map{/COLOR}.{CR} If you're not sure where to go for a quest, check the {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}Map{/COLOR}. You can also open the {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}Simple Map{/COLOR} by pressing {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[N]{/COLOR}.{CR}{CR}{BITMAP name=help_quest_01 w=32 h=32} Denotes an available quest {CR}{BITMAP name=help_quest_02 w=32 h=32} Denotes a quest zone {CR}{BITMAP name=help_quest_03 w=32 h=32} Denotes a quest in progress{CR}{BITMAP name=help_quest_04 w=32 h=32} Denotes a quest that can be turned in

{CR} To access the Cash Shop, press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[ESC]{/COLOR} to open the main menu and {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}click the Cash Shop icon{/COLOR}. {CR} The Cash Shop contains many useful items that will aid you on your adventures!

{CR} Press {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}[ESC]{/COLOR} to open the main menu and click the {COLOR r=0 g=204 b=0}System icon{/COLOR}.{CR} The System menu allows you to change your Game Options, contact a GM, access this Help menu, and view the Keyboard Guide. You can also return to the Character Select screen or quit the game.

{CR} Style determines what skills and weapons your character uses. Each style has unique features. {CR}{CR} The Defender Style uses a one-handed sword or one-handed mace for increased defense and survival. {CR}{CR} The Berserker Style uses a greatsword or warhammer for explosive attack power. {CR}{CR} The Cleric Style uses a staff, one-handed mace, or warhammer for a combination of magic, physical attacks, and healing. {CR}{CR} The Sorcerer Style uses a staff or one-handed sword for ranged magic attacks, buffs, and debuffs.

{CR} The majority of weapons and armor in RaiderZ can only be acquired through crafting. {CR} Collect materials by hunting monsters, completing quests, and gathering from resource nodes such as ore deposits or treasure chests. Use those materials to craft weapons and armor through Artisan NPCs.

{CR} During your battles with monsters and other enemies, you may acquire their weapons, or even parts of the monster itself. {CR} Monster parts give you a variety of buffs and monster weapons let you use different skills temporarily.
{CR} Only members of your party can enter an instance with you. This way, you can complete your objectives without any interference from other players.

{CR} This is a PvP mode in which you can defeat hostile players to accomplish certain objectives. {CR} Victory in PvP can grant you a range of benefits. Some items can only be acquired through quest PvP.
{CR} A system of buying and selling items through a trader NPC. There are Trade Markets in Ingen and Rietz. You must pay a fee to sell your items on the Trade Market.

{CR} Enchant your weapons and armor to maximize their attack and defense and increase other stats. Enchanting can increase your equipment's power up to a maximum of 9 levels.{CR} Enchanters can be found in Ingen and Rietz. Certain rare materials are required for enchanting, and you must pay a fee as well.

{CR} Place jewels in the sockets of weapons and armor to endow them with your own unique stats.{CR} Jewel attachment is available anywhere as long as you have the right materials. Attaching a jewel to a piece of equipment will automatically bind it to you.
This Dye will randomly apply one of the colors shown above.
Click Apply to Dye the selected armor the color shown above.
Successful Element Enhancement on a weapon already enhanced with another element will remove the existing element.{CR}{CR}Do you want to continue?
Place the weapon you want to enhance in the 'Item to Enchant' slot.
It was registered in the wrong location.
The enchanting material is not right for the registered equipment.
Place a Gemstone with the desired element in the 'Element Stone' slot.
There is no enchanting material right for the registered equipment.
You do not have enough money to enchant equipment.
Enhancing a weapon with a different element will reset the existing enhancement.
Press the Enchant Equipment button to start enchanting the equipment.
{COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50} grade decrease prevent {/COLOR}
Destruction rate reducer used. {COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}Item destruction rate has been decreased{/COLOR}.
Enchantment success rate booster used. {COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}Enchantment success rate has been increased{/COLOR}.
The current Element Enhancement has reached its maximum level.
This item cannot be enchanted. Please register enchantable items.
The equipment enchantment has failed and the equipment has been destroyed.
If enchantment fails, the grade of the item may fall or the item may be destroyed.
The equipment enchantment has failed and the enchantment grade has fallen.
The grade of the item may drop after a failed equipment enchantment.
The equipment enchantment has failed and the enchantment grade remains unchanged.
The equipment enchantment has been completed.
An error occurred during enchantment. Please try again later.
Increases {COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}movement speed{/COLOR} for a short time after dodging. Consume this effect to increase {COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}Attack{/COLOR}.
{COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}Increases melee damage and critical hit rate{/COLOR} after 8 successful attacks or use of the Berserk skill.
Increases attack power after use of the {COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}'Possession'{/COLOR} skill, and adds extra effects to {COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}certain Cleric skills{/COLOR}.
{COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}Increases Attack{/COLOR} for a short time after full block or use of certain skills. Allows use of additional skills.

{CR} In order to buy things from the Cash Shop, you will need Zen. You can add Zen to your account by opening the Cash Shop and clicking the {COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}Purchase Zen{/COLOR} button in the upper right. {CR} Zen is not unique to each character. If you have Zen added to your account, all of your characters on that account will be able to purchase from the Cash Shop.

{CR} When you buy an item from the Cash Shop, the item will be placed in your Cash Shop Storage. You must click the {COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}Receive{/COLOR} button in the lower right to transfer the item to your inventory. {CR} You can also choose to place an item in another player's Cash Shop Storage when you buy it. To do this, click the {COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}Gift{/COLOR} button and enter the target player's name. {CR} {COLOR r=255 g=0 b=0}NOTE:{/COLOR} Unlike Zen, Cash Shop Storage is unique to each character. If you have multiple characters on one account, only the character who bought that item will be able to transfer it to their inventory.

{CR}{CR} {COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}Book of Oblivion:{/COLOR} Don't like the way your skills are set up? Always wanted to try a different style? Read this book and all your skill points will be reset, leaving you free to customize your character however you want. {CR} {COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}Scroll of Heroes:{/COLOR} For the truly dedicated mercenary, this scroll can provide a number of useful benefits, such as increased experience gain and reduced enchantment costs. You will even be allowed to use the Premium Teleporters in Ingen and Rietz, who can teleport you directly to field entrances and Epic Monster lairs.
You are logged into RaiderZ Internet Cafe. You can use RaiderZ Internet Cafe Merchants and Teleporters.

{COLOR r=64 g=194 b=90}Assassin Style{/COLOR}{CR}{COLOR r=203 g=209 b=215}An offensive style that uses twin daggers.{CR}The Pursuit focus boosts movement speed after rolling, and this can be consumed to grant the Finesse effect, reinforcing attack power. {/COLOR}

{COLOR r=199 g=91 b=52}Berserker Style{/COLOR}{CR}{COLOR r=203 g=209 b=215}An offensive style that uses two-handed weapons. Their attacks may be slow, but they can deal immense damage. The Outrage focus can unlock even more devastating attacks.{/COLOR}

{COLOR r=239 g=239 b=229}Cleric Style{/COLOR}{CR}{COLOR r=203 g=209 b=215}A support style that uses staves and maces. The Possession focus boosts their attack skills and unlocks new abilities for a number of skills.{/COLOR}

Style determines what skills your character uses. {CR}You can acquire more than one style and combine them to create your very own unique character class!

{COLOR r=222 g=166 b=35}Defender Style{/COLOR}{CR}{COLOR r=203 g=209 b=215}A well-rounded style that uses one-handed weapons and shields. The Counterattack focus lets them increase their attack power by blocking attacks. Their skills focus on surviving.{/COLOR}

{COLOR r=196 g=86 b=161}Sorcerer Style{/COLOR}{CR}{COLOR r=203 g=209 b=215}A ranged attack style that uses one-handed swords and staves to cast fire and ice spells. The Awakening focus allows them to cast spells even faster, becoming a truly great threat.{/COLOR}

The Assassin style focuses on fast hit and run attacks with two daggers.{CR}The Pursuit Focus grants a movement increase when dodging attacks that can be consumed for a short-term attack increase.

Berserker is an offense-oriented style centered around two-handed weapons.{CR}Although slow to attack, a Berserker can home in on the enemy's weak points and deal devastating amounts of damage. The Outrage Focus allows the Berserker to deal even greater damage.

Cleric-style characters not only heal other characters, but also launch magic attacks.{CR}Clerics use a one-handed mace, a warhammer, or a staff, and can use the Possession Focus to temporarily boost their attack skills.
You need 1 skill point to learn this skill. Once used, skill points cannot be recovered. Would you like to learn this skill?

If you learn this skill, you will need to spend at least 10 points in the {COLOR r=50 g=200 b=50}{0} style{/COLOR} in order to learn skills from the other styles.{CR}{CR}Do you still want to learn this skill?

Defender is a well-rounded style that uses a one-handed weapon and a shield.{CR}Defenders can use the Counterattack Focus to gain the upper hand in a fight after blocking an enemy's attack. Defender skills ensure survival during difficult battles.
Sorcerer-style characters launch powerful ranged attacks using ice and fire magic.{CR}Sorcerers use a one-handed sword or staff, and can maximize their magic ability with the Awakening Focus.
